video.title: React Router Crash Course
video.description:
React Router is commonly used to make different routes for pages in React Applications. This crash course will teach you how to create routes in your React applications.

This course covers BrowserRouter, Switch, Nesting Routes, Redirecting Routes, match and history props, including useHistory, useParams, useLocation, and useRouteMatch Hooks.

✏️ Course created by Roadside Coder. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/RoadsideCoder

🔗 8 clean code practices: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dZXpgP9ibf8

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (00:00) Intro
⌨️ (00:51) Initialize new React App
⌨️ (03:16) Header Component
⌨️ (04:42) React Router Installation
⌨️ (05:15) BrowserRouter
⌨️ (05:57) Creating Routes
⌨️ (08:21) Testing Routes
⌨️ (08:39) 'exact' prop
⌨️ (09:25) Switch Tag
⌨️ (10:17) Link Tag
⌨️ (13:32) basename prop
⌨️ (14:06) forceRefresh Prop
⌨️ (14:37) getUserConfirmation
⌨️ (15:54) scroll to top on route change
⌨️ (16:46) 404 Not Found Page
⌨️ (18:21) Access URL Params
⌨️ (20:33) useParams Hook
⌨️ (21:50) useLocation Hook
⌨️ (24:49) Redirecting in React Router
⌨️ (28:05) useHistory Hook
⌨️ (30:55) Nested Routing
⌨️ (38:27) Outro

🎉 Thanks to our Champion and Sponsor supporters:
👾 Wong Voon jinq
👾 hexploitation
👾 Katia Moran
👾 BlckPhantom
👾 Nick Raker
👾 Otis Morgan
👾 DeezMaster
👾 Treehouse

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Burre Ifort
topLevelComment.text:
Browerrouter works in this case, on your local machine because you have got node.js, but it will not work when you deploy to a server. if you refresh the page, when deployed to a server, you will get 404 not found. 
Every single tutorial never talks how to handle it on a real live scenario, like when deployed to a server.

topLevelComment.author: Kaimura 92
topLevelComment.text:
Instead of using getUserConfirmation on <BrowserRouter/> which will be global you can prompt the user to really leave a single route/page by using 
<Prompt when={someCondition} message={"your message"} />
Especially usefull for form pages, when the user hasn't saved his data yet.
